reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 days (1 + 4), had a break for Han Long crusie, the hotel helped out with arranging the cruise, stored our luggage while we were away. The hotel is walking distance from old town and many other places, the reception is excellent in service. The residence has everything that one would expect from a nice hotel. The gym was appreciated, the pool was enjoyed by the kids, a big advantage is the full equipped kitchen with washing machine (something that I would enjoy even if I traveled in business). Additional advantages is the well equipped supermarket in the entry level that makes life so much easier as Hanoi isn't really overcrowded with convenient stores. The apartments are really big an nice, wouldn't mind stay here for a couple of months even with family, feels like home. Definatly highly recommendable...don't look at the Hiltons or Sheratons or Sofitels, we checked them and took this instead. Enjoy it we definatly do and will do again whenever we come back to Hanoi..
reviews.title: Perhaps the best business/family/residence in Hanoi

reviews.text: An ok hotel, we requested non smoking and got clearly a smoking room. Room was small, beds were too hard and lounge area was not good. Buffet breakfast was ok, I have had better.
reviews.title: Soso hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed elsewhere in Hanoi initially ( The Hanoi Elegance Sapphire ) and while pleasant it isnt a patch on the Somerset. We looked at several other properties including the Sofitel, Movenpik and the Hilton but for sheer location and space the Somerset had the edge. Our rate in June 2011 for a one bedroom apartment was US $95 / night a fraction of the others without compromise on room quality and finish. We cherish space when we travel so separate bedroom , lounge, kitchen and bathroom in an 80sqm apartment is perfect. Its not a hotel, but all amenities are close by including a pool, and a shopping mall with supermarket at the base of the tower. It offers free , high speed wifi throughout the building including the bar. Its a very short walk into the old quarter and close to major attractions. Taxis are reliable and cheap, even if the traffic leaves you perplexed and occasionally anxious. Would recommend this place to travellers who want comfortable accomodation without compromise on quality. First class.
reviews.title: Outstanding location, first class facility

reviews.text: An Oasis in crowded Hanoi, just downtown. Excellent service, excellent bar, excellent rooms.
reviews.title: Best base for staying in Hanoi. A place to come back.

reviews.text: stay was comfortable, service good and bar on 4th floor also good. supermarket next door in hanoi towers also handy. it was to a standard one would expect for the price i would not go as far to say exceptional. stayed 5 nights.
reviews.title: good stay would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here with 4 couples and two teenagers in September. We have been left wondering how this hotel could be number 73 on tripadvisor and the negative reviews. For the price paid for a very well fitted out apartment there is very little to complain about. The only very minimal thing we can think of that you could bemoan is the 10 minute walk into the Old Quarter. It is not a new hotel but is in good order. We highly recommend this place for families or couples who are willing to share and want a room with plenty of space at very good rates. Yes it is on the edge of many of the top sites but the main ones are within 15 minute stroll - for those less active taxis are extremely cheap or take the hourly shuttle bus.
reviews.title: Excellent Value sure to return

reviews.text: The buffet breakfast is not 5 star quality but had a good range of choices and the cooked to order omeletes were very tasty.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: The rooms are among some of the better value rooms we have stayed in. We had a two and 3 bedroom exceutive. The beds were very comfortable, delightful soft pillows, 2 bathrooms (smallish) a kitchen with all the facilities including a washer / dryer, tv in lounge and main bedrooms, cd player, and all furnishings were in good oredre and tasteful. The pool area is showing its age - but is being renovated now. The pool is 27 metres long, with about 12 or so comfortable chairs. Water quality of the pool is first rate. The restaurant and bar chain Jaspars has a retsuarant here on the 4th floor next to the pool. Aussies will appreciate the chance to catch up with the cricket, NRL, rugby or AFl on several screens.
reviews.title: Roomy apartment

reviews.text: Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our time here and can recommend it to those after excellent value for money accomodation not to far from teh Old Quater in Hanoi.
reviews.title: very good experience - I recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay in August. We are a family with three children (ages 16, 14 and 10). We stayed in a two bed apt and had another rollaway bed put into the living area. Plenty of space for all of us. I used the washing machine a lot as we were travelling light.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but missing Vietnamese athmospehere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Hanoi Hilton and it is very nice. This time our stay was for a month so decided on an apartment at the Somerset Grand.
reviews.title: For a long stay vastly better than the Hilton

reviews.text: The apartment was spacious and clean with all mod cons. The staff were courteous and friendly.
reviews.title: Business with leisure - very comfortable stay

reviews.text: There is a 20 hour per day Bar and Restaurant and even a supermarket which sells the best continental produce at reasonable prices.
reviews.title: Pricey, but good value, and a great place to stay
Best stay with young children. Just go!
reviews.text: Can highly recommend this establishment.

My husband was based out of Hanoi for two months and we joined him for a month. We had a choice of choosing between a hotel and serviced apartment and decided to go with the latter for the conveniences it gives you when you have a toddler around (read: heating milk or food every few hours, space for running around, friendly staff).
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: If you need a place to stay for an extended period I must recommend the Somerset Grand. It is central, very safe and secure, comfortable and has all the amenities.(Pool, gym, kids playground, great staff etc). There is a travel agency, Citimart grocery store, chocolate shop, hairdresser, kids store etc on the ground level so you really need never leave the complex (especially when it is hot). It is in a fabulous district - just away from the craziness of the backpacker area (Cathedral) and on the edge of the French architecture area. It is close to Cinematheque which is a good place to meet local expats and Vietnamese and see movies and cultural events.
reviews.title: 3 months at the Somerset was very good

reviews.text: There are many adoptive families here and it gives the place a very special feeling. I would come back again and again.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I book this hotel on a deal.
reviews.title: The tv had terrible signal and the shower didnt work properly.

reviews.text: Although rooms are spacious (service apartment), the insulation is none, hence you 'enjoy' Hanoi's noisy traffic and honking all night long.
reviews.title: Ideally located, spacious, great gym - extremely friendly and helpful staff

reviews.text: The hotel was under renovation, I was still checked-in in the wing under renovation; after the works started in the morning, I was then moved to another room (a renovated one, much nicer by the way, but still with no sound proofing). Bathroom lacking of toiletries.
reviews.title: A Nice hotel in Hanoi
